creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund; purchase from the collection of Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: very tall, towering, four-cornered basket with flared top; open, diamond-patterned weave with layers of woven horizontal cross-pattern; handle made from three thin bamboo strips that join at the top, secured with a row of decorative knots; handle separates into three strips at basket lip, adorned with decorative weave at base; tall, red-brown bamboo cylinder lined with copper
medium: Bamboo (hōbichiku or susudake), bamboo (madake?), rattan, lacquer
signed: on bottom, etched: 巧竹斎造之
title: Traversing the Heavens
